comment: Class is super lecture and discussion heavy. The class was on topics in computer science but it all ended up being about LGBT scientists. Just not what I expected nor had any desire to listen to. Homework is expected but no due dates. First day he argued why deaf people need to be astronauts instead of people who can hear...
Without a doubt, The best professor I've ever had.

Amazing speaker, very eye opening lectures. Material can be difficult at times, must take good notes in order to do well. Read assigned text before class. The class consists solely of lectures, so make sure you can sit and listen for a good amount of time. One of my favorite professors thus far.

HIGH QUALITY!!No interest at first but pleasantly surprised Gain new perspective on morals ethics society gender & more Powerful engaging friendly understanding Short,simple work If unclear ask after class!Must take DETAILED notes&listen Record lectures Critical thinking, challenging but end up a better, more informed person. Amazing teacher!!

I went to his class once a week. Didn't really take notes. Used the book heavily. He gives you an unorganized way that he wants his papers written. His lectures go about 5 minutes over. He doesn't care about anyone else's time but his own. Takes all semester to grade assignments.

Tried to enjoy the class. Hard to, given the LONG, UNORGANIZED lectures. The Final is LONG with 11 response/essay questions (does give a week ahead). Feedback is slim to NONE. He doesn't have the decency to respond to your emails regardless of the importance. Hard to take notes-he writes about 10 words on the board each class. Gets off topic quick.

Would not recommend this class. You HAVE to go & take notes, which is hard bc lectures are so boring & long. Weekly papers are not easy to make an A on bc he isn't specific in what he wants, yet grades as if he were. Insane midterm. Went to every class & was dumbfounded by it. Take home final, also insanely hard. Such a slow grader. Would not take

Didn't love it. Short essays due every week or two that weren't bad, but he is not specific on what to write on. The midterm was difficult despite a study guide, which was again not specific enough. Lectures are okay for the most part. Definitely need to show up to class and take notes. SO slow at retuning grades and responding to emails.
I love this professor. Do yourself a favor and take this class because it will change the way you think about things and he's  awesome

Mr. Williams is probably the most phenomenal public speaker I've ever listened to, and I got the impression he didn't want to hand out grades at all. The final exam and term paper are essentially the entire class. Also he is pretty unclear about what you're supposed to actually write about in some cases. A+++ Teacher,  B+ class.

Dr. Williams is really passionate and his lectures don't bore you. Not an easy A, but an easy B+. You have short response papers due every week or two which are pretty simple but the exams are pretty hard. He will not respond to any emails and he is a SLOW grader but he's passionate and will talk with you and help you after class.

Easy class to pass. The two tests are hard but there are one page papers per chapter that are sooo easy to BS and get at least a B on. He NEVER responds to emails and claims he just didn't get them... Interesting course that gets you thinking.
The final is extremely hard and there is a ton of work to do in this class.

Very laid back class; lectures are monotone, but easy enough to follow. He is a nice guy, and gave our class an 11 point curve on the midterm. The Class isn't hard at all, and this is coming from someone who has no interest in philosophy and didn't put forth effort for his papers. He grades his papers leniently, I usually made A's and B's.

To me he was very late returning papers to me online, I had to pester him to give me my graded paper and it usually took him a week to respond, very frustrating. Boring lecture and hard to pay attention to because he was monotone. My advice, if you want an easy grade but want a boring lecture, take it.

I love Philosophy, but I hated this class. Professor Williams was completely uninteresting and not very clear on what he wanted as far as assignments go. I think there were maybe 4 people that showed up to most of the classes. His lectures were loooong and monotone. I was very disappointed, as I had high hopes when I registered for his class.

He is very lenient when grading response papers. The midterm was pretty hard but is still possible to make a good grade but it is not worth much of the total grade. He is also lenient when grading term papers with make up more of your grade than anything else. I would definitely take him again.

Really enjoyed this class. If you miss a day be sure you have someone you can get notes from. Lecture style, but makes it interesting, has a good sense of humor and is a nice guy. Short papers due frequently but he's an easy grader. Only two tests: midterm and final. MIdterm was tough, but the final was much better. Recommend.
Enjoyed the lectures. Tests were pretty difficult but the weekly essays were more highly rated in the grading system, so it wasn't too bad.

If you are an audible learner take this class, it's all lectures. Attendance is not mandatory but if you miss a day you miss a lot. He really knows his stuff but he doesn't teach it well. You have a 1-2 page paper due every week, Midterm & Final, and a term paper. Hard course for me.

It's pretty simple with Prof. Williams. Go to class and take notes. His class is all lecture and it's kind of hard to keep up for the notes. An short essay will be due each week and he's very lenient with grading. Attendance not mandatory but I'd recommend going. If you're genuinely interested in philosophy then his class is for you.

His class was very in depth of the material and if you took notes during his lectures it shouldn't be too hard. We had an essay every week, which he gave back to us with his feedback and he was extremely helpful throughout the semester. I had a Friday 3 hour class with him and he never once had a powerpoint. He knew it all off the top of his head.

I really enjoyed his class even though I had a hard time understanding what he was teaching. I'm just not very interested in this stuff. He is very thorough. I feel like he needs more tests, only a midterm and final and they are iffy. You write a paper almost every week. Easy papers though. Lots of notes, doesn't take attendence but you should go.
Overall a good teacher, had some hiccups when it came to what our tests would be over.  Expect to write an essay almost every week, and make sure you bring some caffeine with you to class.

Great teacher, very helpful and accomidating. However his tests did no reflect the material. Out of 25 pages of notes, his first test only had 25 questions. Everyone failed. No study guide. Go to class everyday, but attendance is not required. Lots of note taking. Overall nto that bad, but his tests need improvment.
